metadata.title: CVE-2024-35830 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:tc358743: register v4l2 async device only after successful setup Ensure thedevice has been setup correctly before registering the v4l2 async device,thus allowing userspace to access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209
linux-image-5.4.0-189-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-189.209
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-113-generic - 5.15.0-113.123~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-113-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-113.123~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-113-generic - 5.15.0-113.123~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-113-generic-64k - 5.15.0-113.123~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1116-kvm - 5.4.0-1116.123
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1075-ibm - 5.4.0-1075.80
No subscription required
